ARABIC: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْجَحِيمِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: savouring what their Lord has given them. Their Lord will safeguard them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Rejoicing at what their Lord has given them; and their Lord will preserve them from the torment of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: enjoying what Allah will have endowed them with; and their Lord will have saved them from the torment of the Blazing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: talking of what they have received from their Lord and of how their Lord has saved them from the torment of hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Delighted at the bestowal of their Lord; and their Lord has saved them from the fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Enjoying in that which their Lord has bestowed on them, and (the fact that) their Lord saved them from the torment of the blazing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Rejoicing because of what their Lord gave them, and their Lord saved them from the punishment of the burning fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: rejoicing in that their Lord has given them; and their Lord shall guard them against the chastisement of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Happy because of what their Lord hath given them, and (because) their Lord hath warded off from them the torment of hell-fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: rejoicing in whatever their Lord has given them. Their Lord has saved them from the torment of the Fire,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Rejoicing in that which their Lord hath vouchsafed Unto them; and their Lord will protect them from the torment of the Flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: rejoicing because of what their Lord has given them, and that their Lord has saved them from the punishment of hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Enjoying the (Bliss) which their Lord hath bestowed on them, and their Lord shall deliver them from the Penalty of the Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Enjoying in that which their Lord has bestowed on them, and (the fact that) their Lord saved them from the torment of the blazing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: rejoicing in all their Lord has given them, and their Lord will guard them against the punishment of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord has spared them the suffering of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [52:18] rejoicing, delighting, in what (bi-mā relates to the verbal action) their Lord has given them, and [that] their Lord has shielded them from the chastisement of Hell-fire (wa-waqāhum rabbuhum ‘adhāba’l-jahīmi is a supplement to ātāhum, ‘[what He] has given them’, in other words, [rejoicing] in their having been given [this reward] and shielded [from Hell-fire]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Happy because of what your Lord hath given them) in the Garden, (and (because) their Lord hath warded off from them the torment of hellfire).
